body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, soldier. Salem, Massachusetts, native. Son of William Buffum and Mary Chace Buffum. Married to Sarah Buffum. Farmer in Salem, Massachusetts in 1850. Served in the 21st Ohio Infantry Volunteers as private and second lieutenant from September 2, 1861, to May 1, 1864. Participated in Andrew's Raid, or "Great Locomotive Chase," on April 12, 1862. Taken by the C.S.A. as a prisoner of war on March 17, 1863. Presented with Medal of Honor on March 24, 1863. Accused of theft and sentenced to three years in Kentucky State Prison in July 1864. Pardoned on August 26, 1864.
